isis.stitle: TSI 94-04-01 - Adjustment Procedures for Air Operated Parking Brake (Code 04GAC)

subjectgroup.subject: Adjustment Procedures for Air Operated Parking Brake (Code 04GAC)

geninfo.para: This TSI applies to 4600, 4600LP, 4700 and 4700LP with hydraulic brakes and Allison AT automatic transmission, Code 834259 air compressor, or a Code 03SAL, 03SAM or 03SAT air suspension. The following service procedure is for adjusting the parking brake on the above listed vehicles.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 1 for all Item numbers.

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 5-1/2 INCHES, WITH AIR PRESSURE APPLIES, ROD EXTENDED

step1.para: Push in on the Parking Brake Valve to release the parking brake.

With air pressure applied (brake released) and the brake chamber rod fully extended, measure from the centerline of the clevis pin to the brake chamber. If the parking brake is properly adjusted, this measurement ( Item "A") will be 5-1/2 inches.
If the rod length needs adjusting, loosen the large jam nut ( Item 1).
Remove the cotter and clevis pins ( Item 3). Remove the clevis from the cam and lever assembly ( Item 4).
Lengthen or shorten dimension "A" by turning the clevis. Be sure the brake chamber rod is fully extended while measuring its length.
When the adjusted dimension is 5-1/2 inches, re-install the clevis ( Item 2) on the cam and lever assembly ( Item 4) and secure with the clevis and cotter pins ( Item 3).
Tighten the large jam nut ( Item 1) against the clevis ( Item 2).

important.para: The large jam nut ( Item 1, Figure 2) that is tightened against the clevis ( Item 2, Figure 2) for normal service can be loosened and turned toward the brake chamber to release the parking brake if there is a parking brake failure or loss of air pressure and the vehicle must be moved.
